summary: You will serve as the substantive and technical expert in providing paralegal advice to the Chief, Deputy Chief, and Assistant United States Attorneys on…
company: US Executive Office for U.S. Attorneys and the...
job_description:
Duties
If selected for this position, you will join a well-respected team in the Special Proceedings Division (SPD) of the United States Attorney's Office for the District of Columbia (USAODC). You will serve as the substantive and technical expert in providing paralegal advice to the Chief, Deputy Chief, and Assistant United States Attorneys on sentence reduction litigation, including issues and changes arising from a variety of statutory developments and court rulings.

Typical work assignments will include:
Manages, tracks and assists in formulating responses to the Division's sentence reduction litigation in U.S. District Court and D.C. Superior Court.Updates and maintains research databases of significant criminal legal opinions and defendants released pursuant to sentence reduction litigation.Gathers and synthesizes the large number of documents that must be considered in assessing motions for reduction of sentence.Independently drafts and develops pleadings, responses to sentence reduction motions, summary overviews and post-appeal challenges.Conducts research of policies, procedures, laws, precedents and statistics pertaining to sentence reduction issues.Utilizes in-depth knowledge of criminal law, with particular emphasis on the specialized and complex body of law applicable to sentence reductions motions and, more broadly, to collateral attacks.

Responsibilities will increase and assignments will become more complex as your training and experience progress.

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a U.S. Citizen or National
Background investigation, credit check, and drug test required
You must be registered for Selective Service, if applicable
If selected, you may be required to complete a one year probationary period.
You must meet all qualification requirements upon the closing date of this announcement.
Qualifications
To qualify as a GS-12 Paralegal Specialist, you must possess one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 level in the Federal Service.

Specialized Experience: Specialized experience is experience that equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be filled. This work demonstrates a practical knowledge of law, litigation and the judicial process, and applicable rules, regulations, policies and procedures. My qualifying experience involved performing the following types of duties: applying various methods of legal research to locate pertinent law, policies, procedures, laws, legislative history, case decisions, statutory development, court ruling and findings in support of cases; analyzing, interpreting and evaluating laws and documents for case relevance and support; communicating with management to provide technical advice, status updates and developments with cases; assist attorneys with preparation for oral arguments; preparing, organizing, and maintaining a variety of substantive legal documents; investigating and becoming familiar with details of cases and other matters; researching, organizing, updating, maintaining, tracking and managing databases independently for informational and analytical purposes; and providing a variety of administrative duties utilizing personal computer (PC) based software, i.e., word processing, spreadsheet or database management in developing legal documents, automated reports and statistical data.

Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP)- The ICTAP provides eligible displaced Federal competitive service employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. If your agency has notified you in writing that you are a displaced employee eligible for ICTAP consideration, you may receive selection priority if: 1) this vacancy is within your ICTAP eligibility; 2) you apply under the instructions in the announcement; and 3) you are found well-qualified for this vacancy. To be well-qualified, you must satisfy all qualification requirements for the vacant position and receive a score of 85 or better on established ranking criteria. You must provide proof of eligibility to receive selection priority. Such proof may include a copy of your written notification of ICTAP eligibility or a copy of your separation personnel action form. Additional information about ICTAP eligibility is at: http://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/.

Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP)-The CTAP provides eligible surplus and displaced competitive service employees in the Department of Justice with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. If your Department of Justice component has notified you in writing that you are a surplus or displaced employee eligible for CTAP consideration, you may receive selection priority if: 1) this vacancy is within your CTAP eligibility, 2) you apply under the instructions in this announcement, and 3) you are found well-qualified for this vacancy. To be well qualified, you must satisfy all qualification requirements for the vacant position and receive a score of 85 or better on established ranking criteria. You must provide a copy of your written notification of CTAP eligibility with your application. Additional information about CTAP eligibility is at http://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/.
Additional information
Payment of relocation expenses will not be authorized.

The Department of Justice offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes, in part, paid vacation; sick leave; holidays; telework; life insurance; health benefits; and participation in the Federal Employees Retirement System.

Selective Service: If you are a male applicant born after December 31, 1959, you must certify that you have registered with the Selective Service System, or are exempt from having to do so under the Selective Service Law. See www.sss.gov.

Current or Former Political Appointees: The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) must authorize employment offers made to current or former political appointees. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule C or Non-Career SES employee in the Executive Branch, you must disclose this information to the HR Office. Failure to disclose this information could result in disciplinary action including removal from Federal Service.

Reasonable Accommodation Statement: Federal Agencies must provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities, where appropriate. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact the hiring agency directly. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.

EEO Statement: The United States Government does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a parent, genetic information, disability, age, membership or nonmembership in an employee organization, or on the basis of personal favoritism.

Benefits

A career with the U.S. government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Opens in a new windowLearn more about federal benefits.
Review our benefits
Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.
How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
Your complete application package (resume/supporting documentation, online questionnaire, and USA Hire Competency Based Assessment) will be evaluated and rated using DOJ's Category Rating and Selection Procedures. Your resume and supporting documentation will be used to determine whether you meet the job qualifications listed on this announcement. If you are basically qualified for this job, your resume and supporting documentation will be compared to your responses on the online questionnaire. If you rate yourself higher than is supported by your application materials, your responses may be adjusted and/or you may be excluded from consideration for this job. If it is determined you meet minimum qualification requirements, your application will then be placed in one of three categories: Best Qualified, Highly Qualified, or Qualified. Within these categories, applicants eligible for Veterans' Preference will receive selection priority over non-veteran preference eligibles. In addition, qualified veterans with a compensable service-connected disability of 10% or more are placed at the top of the highest quality category (i.e., Best Qualified).

You will be rated on the following Competencies (see The Delegated Examining Operations Handbook, Appendix F for definitions):
Attention to Detail, Customer Service, Flexibility, Integrity/Honesty, Interpersonal Skills, Learning, Self-Management, Stress Tolerance, and Teamwork

In order to be considered for this position, you must complete all required steps in the process. In addition to the application and application questionnaire, this position requires an online assessment. The online assessment measures critical general competencies required to perform the job.


Overstating your qualifications and/or experience in your application materials or application questionnaire may result in your removal from consideration. Cheating on the online assessment may also result in your removal from consideration.
Benefits

As a new or existing federal employee, you and your family may have access to a range of benefits. Your benefits depend on the type of position you have - whether you're a permanent, part-time, temporary or an intermittent employee. You may be eligible for the following benefits, however, check with your agency to make sure you're eligible under their policies.

summary:

job_description:
Bachelor's Degree
2+ years experience in program or project management

Job summary
Amazon's legal department is looking for a talented Legal Operations Program Analyst to help support our outside counsel management programs.

Responsibilities are primarily managing conflict waiver requests and coordinating RFIs/RFPs to law firms and legal vendors, but also include supporting our outside counsel management programs and processes, process improvement and simplification, project and change management, data reporting and analysis, spend management, law firm relationship management, and other responsibilities as needed.

A successful candidate will be able to work efficiently and independently in a fast-paced environment, communicate clearly and effectively both verbally and in writing, manage high volumes of tasks and projects with little guidance, react with appropriate urgency to situations and events that require a quick response or turnaround, take effective action without knowing the whole picture, think creatively and strategically, exercise strong judgment, and be proactive and innovative in solving problems that affect customers. The candidate will also be customer-service oriented and have great attention to detail while still meeting tight deadlines, strong organizational skills, and the ability to easily switch gears. A high level of professionalism, integrity, and discretion in handling confidential information, as well as the ability to work well with people at all levels inside and outside the company, are essential.

This position may be based in any of the following locations: Seattle, WA; Arlington, VA; or New York, NY.


Experience defining program requirements; using data and metrics to determine improvements
Experience delivering cross functional projects
Experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams
Experience in outside counsel management or legal operations in a global legal department or large law firm
Experience interacting with high-level executives and law partners
Strong strategic thinking skills
Strong problem solving skills
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to influence without authority across teams and levels
Sound judgment in ambiguous situations
Strong customer service skills
Strong attention to detail
Strong process improvement skills
Strong analytical skills
Strong time management and organizational skills
Desire and aptitude to learn new concepts, programs, and software on the job
Experience with non-hourly value-based fee arrangements
Experience with Serengeti/Legal Tracker or similar enterprise legal e-billing software
Familiarity with Tableau or similar data visualization tools

The Georgia Department of Community Health (DCH) is one of Georgia’s four health agencies serving the state’s growing population of almost 10 million people. DCH serves as the lead agency for Medicaid, oversees the State Health Benefit Plan (SHBP), and includes Healthcare Facility Regulation, impacting one in four Georgians. Through effective planning, purchasing and oversight, DCH provides access to affordable, quality health care to millions of Georgians, including some of the state’s most vulnerable and under-served populations. Six enterprise offices support the work of the agency’s four program divisions. DCH employees are based in Atlanta, Cordele and across the state.
DCH is seeking qualified applicants for the Legal Service Officer with the Office of Inspector General. The Legal Services Officer will report to the Director of Legal for the Office of Inspector General (OIG), and perform work in direct support of OIG. job_description:
Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.

The following position is open in Chicago, Illinois - Legal Counsel, RTD
What makes this a great opportunity?
The members of the Beam Suntory Legal Department are highly regarded by their business colleagues and are closely integrated with Beam Suntory’s global business operations. This close collaboration offers team members a great variety of work and direct interaction with all levels of management, requiring group members to develop deep and broad legal skills and a comprehensive understanding of the business impact of their advise and collaboration.

This role will provide support for various subject matters busines units including our emerging Ready-to-Drink (RTD) business and will also be given other ad hoc projects in support of the Beam Suntory Legal Department. The position requires a person who can prepare and handle sensitive and confidential information with maximum discretion and diplomacy. Candidates must possess considerable initiative, independent judgment, a capability to manage multiple priorities, strong attention to detail and a continuous learning and improvement mentality. This position will report be based in Chicago, IL, and report to the Associate General Counsel – North America.

Role Responsibilities
Reviewing, interpreting, and applying various laws and regulations to provide solutions to business partners
Reviewing, revising, and negotiating a wide array of contracts such as Sponsorship Agreement,
Reviewing and assisting in the creation of product labels, marketing materials and advertising campaigns
Capability to communicate with cross-functional partners in a simple, collaborative, and effective manner
Stay up to date with emerging regulations, trends, and market dynamics
Self-starter with high degree of curiosity to learn numerous aspects of the industry, regulations, and company


Qualifications & Experience
The position will be based at Beam’s Merchandise Mart Offices located in downtown Chicago, IL
J.D. from an accredited law school
3+ years’ experience handling a variety of commercial agreements, and reviewing/applying various regulations to provide solutions to business partners
Prior law firm or in-house experience required
Strong analytical skills with the ability to create practical commercial ideas and solutions
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Decision making skills to help the commercial teams weigh risk/reward when making decisions
Must be organized with ability to prioritize and adjust quickly while managing a heavy workload
Team player who helps in the development of others
Continuous Improvement mindset to evolve the approach
Must work well in an open, team-oriented environment
Must be detail oriented, well organized, able to handle a high-pressure environment, and possess excellent communication skills
Analytical and critical thinking skills sufficient to make decisions regarding daily work that is complex in nature
Must have unquestioned capability to maintain confidentiality; an intense customer service and people orientation, and the willingness to introduce creative ideas in pursuit of continuous improvement
Must be a self-starter and good planner with ability to meet deadlines without exception

At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Beam Suntory is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, military veteran status and all other characteristics, attributes or choices protected by law. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant’s skills and experience.

job_description:
Contract Manager - Legal Negotiations
TechnipFMC is a global leader in the energy industry, specialized in subsea and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 20,000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.
As part of the Legal organization, the Contracts Manager will support the Surface Americas and Measurement and Production Solutions Business Units mainly for the NAM geo-market. Primary responsibilities include the drafting, review, and direct negotiation of all customer facing contracts with existing and potential TechnipFMC customers in order to mitigate risk and ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations and TechnipFMC Policies and Standards.
Job Description:
Main person responsible for drafting, review, and direct negotiation of customer revenue contracts within the scope of the Surface Legal GBU, in compliance with applicable laws, regulations and TechnipFMC Policies and Standards.
Perform the direct negotiation of new contracts and contract amendments with prospective and existing customers, via teleconference or in person as required.
Ensures contractual terms are agreed, accepted and incorporated into the contract.
Oversees the complete life cycle of a contract (from initial request to final signature and contract distribution).
Assists the Tender and Sales departments in the preparation of project bid proposals by communicating contract and commercial processes to ensure consistency in the tender and execution stages, in compliance with TechnipFMC Policies and Standards.
Interfaces with financial and project personnel for contracting strategies.
Supports the Management Team in the identification and assessment of contractual risks and, when applicable, prepares and distributes Deviation Approval Forms in order to obtain the appropriate written approvals for any deviations from TechnipFMC Policies and Standards.
Contributes to business strategy by proposing and implementing creative solutions that further business objectives while minimizing or mitigating risk.
Advises and assists all departments and personnel within the company on various matters associated with contract activities, performance, project problems, claims and other company potential issues requiring interpretation and resolution.
Provides training and workshops on TechnipFMC legal and contract policies, standards and methodologies to relevant stakeholders.
Manages, maintains and uploads all assigned contractual and commercial documentation within TechnipFMC’s proprietary systems.
Supports and collaborates with other team members. Participates in team meetings.
You are meant for this job if
Bachelor’s Degree required.
Minimum of six (6) years’ experience in legal, commercial and contractual matters in a corporate environment with the ability to identify, analyze, interpret and mitigate legal risk, preferably in the oil and gas industry.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Outstanding negotiation skills and experience.
High level of integrity and ethics.
Ability to work independently under general guidance and/or self-initiative with accuracy and attention to detail.
Manage priorities and meet individual and team deadlines.
Able to solve practical business problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Ability to provide consultative advice to all levels of management and employees with effectiveness and with the appropriate level of sensitivity.
Demonstrates exceptional planning, interpersonal and communication skills.
PC skills with proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, project, and presentation software (MS Office).
Ability to give and receive constructive feedback and coaching, performance management, and respond appropriately.
Ability to understand and communicate within diverse cultural environments is critical.

Preferred Qualifications
Juris Doctorate, Master’s in law (LLM) or equivalent.
Fluently speak, write, and interpret Spanish and/or Portuguese.

job_title: newLegal Assistant- Loyola Social Justice Law Clinics
summary:
Experience as a paralegal, legal secretary or investigator strongly preferred.
Collaborate with Senior Administrative Coordinator and the Director of Operations…
job_description:
Provide administrative-legal support to faculty and staff in their roles as attorneys and advance the operations of LSJLC as a law firm (i.e. legal secretary capabilities); support the implementation of policies and procedures for student attorneys through reporting, training and quality control/compliance as needed.
The Loyola Social Justice Law Clinic
The Loyola Social Justice Law Clinic (LSJLC) is a collective of several live-client legal clinics at Loyola Law School with two main goals: to advance social justice by providing free, best-practices legal advocacy to individuals who would otherwise fall through the “justice gap”; and to provide law students with practical experience in real-world lawyering skills. Operationally, the LSJLC is therefore a hybrid organization: a law firm housing several legal practices and also an educational program consistent with the social justice mission, and the policies and practices, of Loyola Law School and its parent institution, Loyola Marymount University. The LSJLC’ s eight in-house live-client clinical programs are staffed by over 30 fulltimeattorneys, paralegals, fellows, social workers and policy researchers. In addition, the LSJLC oversees part-time clinics taught off-site by adjunct faculty.
Position Summary : Provide administrative-legal support to faculty and staff in their roles as attorneys and advance the operations of LSJLC as a law firm (i.e. legal secretary capabilities); support the implementation of policies and procedures for student attorneys through reporting, training and quality control/compliance as needed.
Position Specific Responsibilities/Accountabilities :
Assist attorneys with generation and filing of petitions and briefs; file and serve pleadings; perform basic legal research; cite check and format pleadings for filings; help prepare for hearings; provide assistance with locating witnesses and conducting interviews.
Complete and submit all necessary forms for prison visits; coordinate schedules with clients in prison; oversee student, staff and faculty compliance with prison-visit protocols and procedures.
Collaborate with Senior Administrative Coordinator and the Director of Operations in the creation and maintenance of digital and paper case files; enforce staff, faculty and student compliance with case file protocols as needed; scan case files into Filevine and flag problems; provide intake as needed; with Senior Administrative Coordinator, support student compliance; open and respond to case-related mail; generate acknowledgment and rejection letters as needed; track case progress and keep faculty apprised; provide clients with periodic case status updates.
Perform conflict checks as needed
Calendar court appearances, hearings, client-related events, intake events; schedule client appointments and consultations.
Collaborate with the Senior Administrative Coordinator on data entry into Filevine; develop and evolve Filevine protocols with the Senior Administrative Coordinator and the Director of Operations.
Ensure that all retainers, confidentiality agreements, clinic policies and procedures are recent and up to date.
Perform other related duties as assigned or requested. The Law School reserves the right to add or change duties at any time.
Loyola Marymount University Expectations :
Exhibit behavior that supports the mission, vision, and values of the university. Communicate and employ interpersonal actions that model high standards of professional, responsible, accountable, and ethical conduct. Demonstrate a commitment to outstanding customer service.
Requisite Qualifications:
Typically a Bachelor’s Degree. Combined experience/education may be substituted. Incumbent will be expected to continue upgrading knowledge, skills, and abilities.
Minimum 1 year of experience in a legal setting preparing legal documentation, briefs, appeals, petitions, pleadings and subpoenas required. Experience as a paralegal, legal secretary or investigator strongly preferred. Experience in social justice work highly desirable.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to take initiative and juggle multiple tasks and priorities with minimal supervision. Must have strong organizational and problem-solving skills.
A passion for social justice, knowledge of Word, Excel. Knowledge of case management software and Accounts Payable systems (i.e. Concur) strongly preferred. Spanish fluency desired.
For full consideration, applicants should submit the following items: 1) a current and comprehensive resume and 2) cover letter.
COVID Vaccination Requirement
To ensure the safety and well-being of our community Loyola Marymount University requires that all students, faculty and staff are vaccinated or have been approved for a qualifying medical or religious exemption.
Staff Term (Fixed Term)

job_description:
Summary
NFL Compliance partners with Security and Internal Audit and other League functions to identify and manage risk - legal, financial, and reputational. NFL Compliance is responsible for ensuring effective policies and procedures mitigate these risks, that NFL staff understand these policies and procedures, and to provide guidance and serve as a resource to staff. NFL Compliance monitors for adherence to league policies and procedures and reviews potential situations of non-compliance. Managing risks relating to third-party vendors is also an important feature of the League’s compliance program. NFL Compliance supports all League offices, including international, and provides guidance to NFL teams.
The Director will assist the Vice President of Compliance in promoting a corporate culture where employees meet the NFL’s core values, acting with integrity and following the highest ethical standards.
Responsibilities
Support the maintenance of a robust compliance program to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulatory matters and with League policies
Instill a culture of ethics and integrity throughout the League
Recommend, develop, and implement changes to policies and procedures, oversee revisions, and publish new and updated compliance policies and procedures
Provide advice and guidance to management and staff regarding compliance, mitigation of risk, and protection of brand
Develop and implement compliance training
Compile and maintain key compliance metrics; report metrics to management
Support and conduct internal investigations concerning potential violations of League policies
Required Qualifications
Juris Doctor required
7 years of experience in Law, Compliance or Risk Management or a combination thereof; combination of corporate compliance experience (policy development and training) and regulatory enforcement (DOJ/SEC/State Attorney General/other regulatory) a must
Other Key Attributes/Characteristics
Candidate must have a proven track record of developing and driving multiple product initiatives from start to finish
Superior leadership skills, including ability to prioritize multiple demands, use good judgment, and make decisions that greatly impact the business
Strong expectation management, influencing and conflict resolution skills
Strong ability to collaborate across various groups, build relationships and manage effectively in a matrix organization.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically, work independently and develop strategies to prioritize legal issues
Ability to quickly build credibility and influence among executives and peers
Team player, and willing to roll up sleeves when needed to get the job done
Travel
Travel within US and internationally (20%)
Terms/Expected Hours of Work
Role is full time and may require work on the weekends, as needed.
FLSA exempt.
The NFL places a priority on having an in-person workplace, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success. We remain steadfast in our belief that working together as a team, in our physical office spaces, is critical to the successful execution of our season. For those reasons, we expect employees to work from an NFL office five days a week, except in limited circumstances permitted by NFL policy.
The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
We also continue to prioritize the health and safety of our NFL workforce. consistent with that commitment, considering the substantial and growing body of evidence that vaccinations remain the most effective protection against the spread the COVID-19, we require that members of our NFL workforce be fully vaccinated, inclusive of the COVID-19 Booster for those who are eligible under CDC guidelines.

DESCRIPTION
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

Department Profile
The lawyers and other professionals within the Legal & Compliance Division (Legal) provide a wide range of services to our business units. They might help to structure a complex and sensitive cross-border transaction; advise on a new product introduction; develop a training program or defuse an investor dispute. They preserve the firm?s invaluable reputation for integrity and protect the firm with policies and procedures that meet regulatory requirements around the world. They also strive to maintain cooperative relationships with governmental policy makers and the regulatory and self-regulatory agencies that govern the firm's businesses.
Legal professional for the Company Law group working on corporate governance-related matters for the Firm's regulated U.S. subsidiaries.

Corporate governance, including preparation, organization and maintenance of materials for board and committee meetings;
Board and committee charters, resolutions and meeting minutes and governance matters;
Legal entity lifecycle management (formation, mergers, dissolutions) and information requests regarding the Firm?s legal entities
Special projects related to ongoing legal entity framework/oversight initiatives and related work-streams and reorganization projects.

QUALIFICATIONS
The candidate should have excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
The candidate should be detail-oriented and know how to identify matters requiring escalation or special attention.
The position requires a level of experience and maturity to be able to exercise sound judgment, work independently and effectively manage a wide variety of responsibilities.
Some financial services and banking experience will be a plus but is not required.

About The Position
Glassbox is looking for a Legal Ops Specialist to join our Global Legal team.
We are Glassbox, a world leader in digital experience analytics, on a mission to deliver frictionless digital journeys to brands and their customers all over the world.
We are a hyper-growth scale-up that has most recently acquired a strong player in the CX field- SessionCam and just IPO’d in June!
So, now is the perfect time to come to Glassbox and help us accelerate our global leadership position!
Will you join us in this journey?
The ideal candidate is a self-starter, proactive, and tech-savvy, who enjoys working in an ever-evolving, fast-paced environment. This position is an individual contributor role, reporting to the Head of Legal Operations.
What You Will DoContribute to the development and maintenance of internal guides, training, and processesMaintain accurate, up-to-date processes and procedure documentationAssist with legal and cross-functional projects as they ariseOptimize operational effectiveness through identifying productivity opportunitiesAssist with implementing supporting programs, processes, and tools to improve workflowsAdministrate the company’s contract management database, archiving contracts, and tracking active agreementsOperate, maintain, and implement systems and processes that support various contract requestsRespond to inquiries regarding contract obligations and amendmentsMonitor agreements throughout the contract life cycle for milestones, approvals, expirations, etc.Identify potential administrative inefficiencies and brainstorm courses of action that promote the company’s interests while also meeting legal and contractual requirements
Requirements
What You Will Need 2-5 years of relevant experience preferably in a start-up or other rapid-growth phase companyA bachelor’s degree or higherExperience managing document databasesExcellent analytical capabilities and detail-orientationA proactive approach to recognizing needs, solving problems, anticipating issues, and developing solutionsStrong organizational skills with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously to meet goals and deadlines in a very fast-paced environmentAbility to embrace and adapt to frequent change and face new challengesStrong communication skills both verbally and writtenIn-depth knowledge in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word﻿
An advantage
Experience with contract management or database platformsKnowledge of contract structure and ability to identify specific provisions contained within contractsExperience implementing and managing legal technology solutions, including change management

job_description:
Tripadvisor 2022 Legal Fellow Job Description
Tripadvisor (NASDAQ: TRIP) operates the world's largest travel guidance website, enabling hundreds of millions of people each month become better travelers, from planning to booking to taking a trip. Travelers across the globe use the Tripadvisor site and app to discover where to stay, what to do and where to eat based on guidance from those who have been there before. With more than 988 million reviews and opinions of nearly 8 million businesses, travelers turn to Tripadvisor to find deals on accommodations, book experiences, reserve tables at delicious restaurants and discover great places nearby. As a travel guidance company available in 43 markets and 22 languages, Tripadvisor makes planning easy no matter the trip type.

The Legal Department is involved in all aspects of the Tripadvisor business, including contract drafting and negotiation, intellectual property, litigation threat assessment and management, internet law, privacy law, consumer marketing law, international legal issues, mergers and acquisitions, employment law, regulatory matters and compliance.

Our Legal Department is seeking a 2022 law school graduate to serve as a Tripadvisor In-House Legal Fellow for a two-year term, beginning in September 6, 2022 and ending August 30, 2024 at our Needham headquarters (operating virtually until such time as our Needham office reopens later in 2022). The Legal Fellow will report to the Associate General Counsel,and will have the opportunity to work closely with Tripadvisor's legal team and business departments concerning a diverse and wide variety of legal matters.

Job Description:
Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:

 Drafting and reviewing partner and vendor contracts, including non-disclosure agreements, partnership agreements, software licensing agreements and more.
 Reviewing marketing materials, site features, and various corporate communications for various Tripadvisor group companies.
 Drafting and tracking intellectual property enforcement actions worldwide.
 Assisting with the review and updates for the standard company contracts for Tripadvisor and its affiliates.
 Reviewing terms of use and privacy policy for Tripadvisor and its affiliate companies
 Performing associated legal research projects.
 Working with counsel to analyze and update responses to notice and takedown requests and track status of the same.
 Assistance with identifying, organizing and editing contracts.
 Assistance with litigation and regulatory filings, domestically and internationally.
 Support for multiple business units, including but not limited to: B2C (Consumer), B2B (Business), Marketing, Hotels Advertising and Sales, Experiences and Restaurants.
 Other assorted projects assigned by the legal counsel in the US, Europe and Asia, potentially including assistance with mergers & acquisition and securities law projects.

location: Hybrid remote in Los Angeles, CA+1 location
job_description:
Founded in 1912, Paramount Pictures works with the entertainment industry’s biggest filmmakers and brightest stars to produce and distribute entertainment around the world. The iconic Paramount logo has opened some of the most successful and beloved films in cinematic history, including timeless classics such as Sunset Boulevard, The Godfather, Forrest Gump and Ferris Bueller’s Day Off; and blockbuster franchises such as Star Trek, Transformers, and Mission: Impossible. Recent innovative break-out films such as A Quiet Place and Rocketman have further elevated Paramount’s film legacy. On the small screen, Paramount Television Studios’ Defending Jacob, 13 Reasons Why, The Haunting of Bly Manor, The Alienist: Angel of Darkness, Made for Love and Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan have also been thrilling audiences. With a beautiful 65-acre lot in the heart of Hollywood, a worldwide network of offices and a culture of engagement, Paramount’s passionate employees ensure the studio continues to deliver creativity and innovation to a dynamic industry. Paramount is a subsidiary of ViacomCBS, which reaches 700 million global subscribers through MTV, Nickelodeon, Comedy Central, BET and other media networks.

SUMMARY:
The Legal Assistant will provide administrative support to Vice President, Business Affairs with an emphasis on managing busy calendars and phone calls. This is a hybrid/remote position with the flexibility of working a few days per week in the office and a couple of days at home!

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Handles general administrative duties, including answering phones, rolling calls, scheduling internal/external appointments and meetings, maintaining daily schedules and calendars, handling e-mail distributions and incoming/outgoing mail, handling visitor requests, updating contact information, generating expense reports, and ordering supplies
Distributes files, and keeps internal/external agreements and correspondence organized
Maintains tickler system for follow-up; updates entries of the status of projects and deals in status reports
Composes and generates letters, term sheets, and internal deal memos (using a data-based online program)
Liaises with internal departments and external entities

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
At least 2 years of entertainment or legal administrative experience is strongly preferred (in a fast-paced office)
Deep proficiency with MS Suites, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe Acrobat, and the internet

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree is preferred
Excellent written, verbal, and telephone skills
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate with staff, administrators, internal and external executives, colleagues, senior management, and talent representatives from outside offices
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Strong time management skills with the ability to address multiple high priorities prioritizing work, demands, and other anticipating needs
Highly proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, collaborative, resourceful, and a strong sense of judgment to exercise diplomacy and discretion

ViacomCBS is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) including disability/vet.

At ViacomCBS, the spirit of inclusion feeds into everything that we do, on-screen and off. From the programming and movies we create to employee benefits/programs and social impact outreach initiatives, we believe that opportunity, access, resources and rewards should be available to and for the benefit of all. ViacomCBS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, and Veteran status.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access. https://www.viacomcbs.com/careers as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by calling 212.846.5500 or by sending an email to viacomaccommodations@viacom.com. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned.

job_description:
Duties
As a VISUAL INFORMATION SPECIALIST at the GS-1084-12 some of your typical work assignments may include:

Directs, manages and produces the contribution of multimedia content for Airman magazine, AF.mil and other official Air Force information products.
Shoots, gathers and edits video, sound, and still media to help form feature multimedia products to inform audiences and strategically communicate messages from senior Air Force leadership.
Ensure all multimedia products support Air Force strategic communication objectives, and incorporate strategic messages to targeted audiences at the initial stage of development.
Develops Airman Magazine multimedia and broadcast standards, procedures and templates to facilitate production and ensure quality and control.
Delegates assignments; provides instruction and guidance to associate multimedia producers and complies with deadlines for each issue.
Ensure all multimedia products are properly formatted to meet resolution, codec and quality standards.

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be a U.S. citizen
Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for, or exempt from, Selective Service http://www.sss.gov
Resume and supporting documents (See How To Apply)
Suitable for Federal employment, determined by a background investigation
May be required to successfully complete a probationary period
Work Schedule: Fulltime
Overtime: Occasionally
Tour of Duty: Flexible
Recruitment Incentives: Not Authorized
Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA): Exempt
Financial Disclosure: Not Required
Telework Eligibility: This position is telework eligible
COVID19: Please see, additional information.
Digital video and audio portfolios will be requested. They can be in the form of a link to a web-based portfolio or links to individual products produced.
Qualifications
In addition to meeting the specialized experience qualifications for this position, your application package must reflect the applicable experience to meet the Individual Occupational Requirements for the 1084 series.
Education
Undergraduate and Graduate Education: Major study - commercial art, fine arts, art history, industrial design, architecture, drafting, interior design, photography, visual communication, or other fields related to the position. Some positions may also require subject-matter knowledge of medicine, science, or technical equipment.
Advanced training in a vocational school, technical institute, or art institute above the high school level in one of the fields listed above is creditable as general experience on a month-for-month basis.
OR
Experience
Specialized Experience (for positions above GS-5): Experience in the actual type of work for which application is made. Unpaid experience is creditable, provided the work done was of a quality level and demonstrated the ability required for the position. This includes planning the preparation and use of photographs, illustrations, drawings, and other art work, charts, diagrams, dioramas, maps, slides, overlays, and other kinds of visual material for use in communicating information through visual meansNOTE: Failure to provide transcripts will result in you being rated ineligible for this position.

You may qualify at the GS-12, if you fulfill the following qualifications:

One year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 grade level in the Federal service:
Create video and motion graphics products for web and social media;
Create web products (video stories, short explainer videos, written and photo stories, designs, logos, animations, illustrations, flyers, promotional advertisements, 3D models, and posters);
Shoot, gather, and edit video, sound, and still media to help form feature multimedia products;
Strategically communicate messages using original multimedia products to inform audiences.
Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.
Education
Substitution of education may not be used in lieu of specialized experience for this grade level.

ARE YOU USING YOUR EDUCATION TO MEET THE INDIVIDUAL OCCUPATION REQUIREMENT? You MUST provide transcripts or other documentation to support your educational claims. Unofficial transcripts are acceptable at time of application.

All materials must be submitted by the closing date of the announcement.

GRADUATE EDUCATION: One academic year of graduate education is considered to be the number of credits hours that your graduate school has determined to represent one academic year of full-time study. Such study may have been performed on a full-time or part-time basis. If you cannot obtain your graduate school's definition of one year of graduate study, 18 semester hours (or 27 quarter hours) should be considered as satisfying the requirement for one year of full-time graduate study.

FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show that the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: Foreign Education
Additional information
To ensure compliance with an applicable preliminary nationwide injunction, which may be supplemented, modified, or vacated, depending on the course of ongoing litigation, the Federal Government will take no action to implement or enforce the COVID-19 vaccination requirement pursuant to Executive Order 14043 on Requiring Coronavirus Disease 2019 Vaccination for Federal Employees. Federal agencies may request information regarding the vaccination status of selected applicants for the purposes of implementing other workplace safety protocols, such as protocols related to masking, physical distancing, testing, travel, and quarantine.
Due to COVID-19, the agency is currently in an expanded telework posture. If selected, you may be expected to temporarily telework, even if your home is located outside the local commuting area. Once employees are permitted to return to the office, you will be expected to report to the duty station listed on this announcement within 60 days. At that time, you may be eligible to request to continue to telework one or more days a pay period depending upon the terms of the agency's telework policy.

Re-employed Annuitant: This position does not meet criteria for re-employed annuitant. The DoD criteria for hiring Re-employed Annuitants can be found at: https://www.esd.whs.mil/Portals/54/Documents/DD/issuances/140025/1400.25-V300.pdf


All applicants must meet qualifications and eligibility criteria by the closing date of the announcement.


Interagency Career Transition Assistance Programs: This program applies to employees who have been involuntarily separated from a Federal service position within the competitive service or Federal service employees whose positions have been deemed surplus or no longer needed. To receive selection priority for this position, you must: 1) meet ICTAP eligibility criteria; 2) be rated well-qualified for the position; Well qualified is defined as possessing the type and quality of experience that exceeds the positions minimum qualifications. and 3) submit the appropriate documentation to support your ICTAP eligibility. We will review your resume and supporting documents, to ensure you meet the basic qualification requirements. Audio and Video Production

Creative Thinking

Vision

Based on the results of this evaluation, you will be placed in one of the following quality categories:

Best Qualified: This highest category will be used for those candidates who possess the type and quality of experience that substantially exceeds the minimum qualifications of the position, including any selective placement factors and/or appropriate quality ranking factor(s), as determined by the job analysis.
Highly Qualified: This higher category will be used for those candidates who possess the type and quality of experience that exceed the minimum qualifications of the position, including any selective placement factors and/or appropriate quality ranking factor(s) as determined by the job analysis.
Qualified: This lowest category will be used for those candidates that meet the minimum qualifications of the position, including all selective placement factors and appropriate quality ranking factor(s) and are proficient in some, but not all, of the requirements of the position. job_description:
Summary
Posted: Feb 7, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200318128
Position has flexibility to sit in other Apple office locations such as Cupertino (CA), Elk Grove (CA) and possibly others. Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly! Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish! Do you love tackling big challenges without precedent? Do you possess a deep knowledge of the legal field and a passion for innovation? As a part of our Legal group, you’ll help uphold Apple’s high ethical and corporate standards, as well as defend our intellectual property. You’ll help provide legal support for all our products and businesses across the globe. Working for a company that invents entire categories and industries means you’ll be challenged to creatively apply your deep legal expertise to rare and often unexplored aspects of the law. Together with your team, you’ll provide the critical support needed worldwide for all Apple products and businesses. The Legal Operations team is seeking a hardworking eBilling Analyst to join the eBilling and Vendor Management team. The ideal candidate will have previous eBilling experience and is interested in providing excellent customer service.
Key Qualifications
5+ years experience in Legal billing or equivalent
Proven knowledge of Legal Support Functions; eBilling, Matter/Vendor Management, counsel support, and training
Previous experience reviewing/approving invoices and handling budgets
Desire to dive deep into recurring issues and implement long-term solutions
Ability to build and maintain business partnerships with peers across the Legal group
Customer service oriented attitude
Strong, clear, and concise verbal and written communication skills
Analytical skills and attention to detail are essential
React with appropriate urgency to situations that require a quick response
Capacity to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team
Proven understanding of / in enterprise eBilling/matter management software
Experience with Mac OS, Excel, and SAP
Description
The size and complexity of Apple’s LGS Group is scaling in line with the Company’s growth. This role will assist in supporting our key billing and general operational processes. It will report to the Legal Operations Manager, e-Billing & Vendor Management. • First Pass assessment and review of invoices submitted to Apple’s various Legal teams • Provide Legal staff with eBilling and matter management advice, training, and support • Provide outside counsel billing managers with billing and budgeting support • Lead all aspects of the helpdesk as first level of escalation, data analytics, and trending • Optimization of helpdesk workflows based on evolving analytics • Assessing and completing help tickets including budget and matter inquiries • Conduct deep dive into complex billing issues as they arise and resolving • Assist in Timekeeper rate setting and addition to the system • Coordinate special projects, as needed
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree – preferably in a finance, business or legal discipline.
Additional Requirements

job_description:
MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Advise and provide legal guidance to support and advance the Authority’s overall strategic vision, goals and objectives while ensuring the Authority acts within its enabling legislation.
Provide institutional insight and information regarding prior and current Authority initiatives and practices.
Assist executive leadership team with achieving board initiatives.
Prepare and present a report of legal matters at board of commissioners/directors’ meetings.
Oversee and manage general counsel and special counsel projects and budgets.
Assist outside legal counsel with potential and known wrongful acts including litigation matters and insurance claims.
Manage dissemination of records and information requested through the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA).
Advise and provide legal support, interpretation, direction, and guidance regarding city, state, and federal laws and regulations to maximize effectiveness of daily operations.
Manage the development, implementation and maintenance of policies, practices and procedures that impact the MCCNO and its operations.
Ensure organizational compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
Identify operational risk areas and manage the policies and practices to protect the interests of the organization and minimize financial and reputation exposure.
Serve as liaison between staff and third parties to ensure internal project needs including, but not limited to; employee matters, employment practices, labor relations, event contracts and capital planning are supported.
Lead the daily operations of the Contracts team and offer legal guidance for the operating and capital expenditure contracting process.
Identify opportunities and follow state, local, internal, and federal (if applicable) laws and policies to ensure a competitive solicitation.
Make certain contracts are approved, executed, and filed timely. Address any conflicts, protests, or disputes in accordance with laws and policies.
Recommend contract execution, contract modifications, and renewals.
Review ongoing contract compliance and facilitate meetings with third parties.
ACCOUNTABILITIES FOR SUPERVISION
Participate in decisions related to the selection, promotion, transfer, pay and discipline of assigned personnel.
Orient employees to MCCNO policies and procedures, clearly communicate job duties and responsibilities so individuals may proceed with certainty in the performance of their positions.
Personally conduct or oversee training for new employees to ensure established procedures are clearly understood and followed.
Monitor the work performance of assigned personnel on a continual basis, conduct effective performance appraisals, and take corrective action whenever necessary.
Create a working climate in which assigned personnel are motivated to develop their skills and abilities and demonstrate by personal example the desired standards of conduct and work performance.
Administer MCCNO policies in a fair and equitable manner with regard to discipline, tardiness, absenteeism or insubordination and fully document all incidents and actions taken.
Other Skills and Abilities
Superior verbal and written communication skills so as to handle sensitive inquiries or complaints effectively.
Strong research and analytical skills to review information using sound judgment to arrive at well documented conclusions.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to maintain confidentiality.
Other Qualifications
Demonstrated experience with Louisiana contract law and compliance required.
Experience
Required
Member of LA State Bar or member in good standing with the Louisiana State Bar Association required.
Preferred
Juris Doctor (J.D) degree from an accredited law school and ten years plus of experience preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

summary:

Our team is responsible for analyzing and interpreting legal regulations…
job_description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year experience with export compliance and licensing.
Authorization to work in the United States.
Preferred qualifications:

Working knowledge of Google Workplace.
Ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure.
Willingness to work on a broad range of legal matter.
Excellent project management, verbal/written communication skills, and attention to detail.
About the job
20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for taking on some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
The Global Trade Compliance Legal team's goal is to enable and support the company's import and export needs while ensuring compliance with trade regulations.
Our team is responsible for analyzing and interpreting legal regulations and statutes, advising customers, and submitting government filings. As a Legal Assistant, you will have a lead role in preparing materials for the filing of deemed-export license applications, including engaging and coordinating with internal groups, communicating with recruiters, and candidates to gather information, and driving the management of filed and issued licenses. You are a confident and polished communicator and writer and possess a technical aptitude. You are comfortable troubleshooting issues, documenting work, and moving issues and resolutions forward at a steady pace. You will manage multiple tasks efficiently, use excellent acumen, and work productively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
Responsibilities
Review export control questionnaires from employees and visitors and allow-listing individuals to access projects and/or sites.
Help with general case management administration and organization of key documents.
Assist with the collection of relevant materials to file license applications.
Coordinate with external legal counsel and analyze data; identify potential risk areas.
Assist with other facets of Google’s export compliance program as needed; assist with deemed export license applications, letters of assurance, and tracking.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

job_description:
BigCommerce's mission is to help merchants sell more at every stage of growth, from small startups, to mid-market businesses to large enterprises. We focus on being the best ecommerce platform so our customers can focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

We are equally passionate about growing our employee's careers and providing them an incredible experience as we rapidly expand across the globe. We are proud to have been recognized numerous times for our product and workplace culture. We empower our people and customers to build, innovate and grow, so together we can redefine the ecommerce industry.
BigCommerce, named a "Best Place to Work" in Austin in 2021, is looking for a Legal Analyst to join our lean, top-notch Legal team in our Austin Four Points (Headquarters) office. As a key member of the team, you will work closely with our in-house attorneys to provide support and guidance on legal initiatives and collaborate frequently with other departments on various projects, contracts and matters requiring legal input. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication and organization skills, be able to work at a fast pace and have strong attention to detail. This is an entry-level role ideal for a recent graduate ready to get their feet wet in pursuit of a career in legal.

What You'll Do
Investigate, prioritize, and manage all escalated requests for legal review and present the resulting research to attorneys by providing detailed background, analyzing risk vs. benefit, anticipating areas of conflict and proposing creative solutions
Clearly communicate legal responses and recommendations to applicable teams and stakeholders
Develop and maintain repositories of legal responses and create legal resources for use/reference by applicable teams within the organization
Work with attorneys to identify legal risks to the business, conduct investigations and make recommendations for solutions
Identify and implement process improvements within the Legal team and with stakeholders in other departments
Conduct thorough initial review of contracts in relation to internal legal thresholds and criteria
Review, negotiate and revise nondisclosure agreements and procurement contracts (with support of our attorneys)
Assist attorneys with preparation, review and negotiation of other legal documents and redlines
Draft routine letters and other legal correspondence
Assist with developing best practice policies, playbooks and automation across various contract lifecycles
Review contracts for completeness and accuracy, including but not limited to ensuring documents are properly signed and retrieving additional information when necessary
Manage BigCommerce's contracting process by tracking authorizations and correspondence
Monitor and maintain data quality within BigCommerce's contract management system
Handle miscellaneous administrative tasks including managing contract files and templates for the Legal team, locating agreements, uploading and organizing fully executed copies of legal documents, etc.
Assist attorneys and other teams with ad hoc research and projects as necessary
Who You Are
Bachelor's Degree
Strong interest in the legal field and/or in pursuit of a career in legal
Fast learner with strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a high attention to detail
SaaS or technology company experience is a plus, but not required
Comfortable working with Microsoft Office (including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and Google Apps (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Sheets, etc.)
Familiarity with Salesforce, Conga and DocuSign preferred, but not required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to think ahead and anticipate issues before they arise
Takes ownership of work and sees projects through to completion
Ability to work in a confidential manner due to access to information of a sensitive nature
Excellent time management, organizational and prioritization skills. Works efficiently and can be flexible and switch gears quickly if projects need to be set aside for high priority escalations and urgent matters
Team player with ability to communicate and collaborate effectively at all levels of the organization in a professional manner
Capable of working independently and seeking assistance when needed
Maintains a positive attitude and good sense of humor even while working under pressure

job_description:
Zimmer Biomet is a world leader in musculoskeletal health solutions. Our team members are part of a company with a heritage of leadership, a focus on shaping the future, and a mission dedicated to alleviating pain and improving the quality of life for people around the world.

The Legal Counsel will be responsible for providing legal advice and support to the Technology and Data Solutions business on a broad range of issues, with an emphasis on commercial contract drafting and negotiation. Collaborate with Legal colleagues and business partners to devise appropriate legal strategies associated with business unit.

This position is fully remote.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities
• Draft, review and negotiate the terms of various commercial agreements for products developed by the Technology and Data Solutions business including, but not limited to, purchase and sale, software license, consignment, services, distribution and business associate agreements.
Develop, review, update and file template and executed agreements on an ongoing basis.Partner with colleagues to ensure agreements are consistent with stakeholder objectives, applicable legal requirements, and internal corporate policies.Manage processes governing the intake, review, and approval of contracts and other legal requests.Advise on business law issues, including contract interpretation and requirements.Provide pragmatic day-to-day and strategic advice to minimize legal risks while facilitating and advancing business goals and initiatives.Instruct, manage and review all work product of external counsel in an efficient and cost-effective manner.Carry out other duties, projects, or activities as specified by the Associate General Counsel, Commercial Solutions.
Expected Areas of Competence
• Well organized, detail-oriented, and accountable with a high degree of professionalism, diplomacy, discretion and judgment.
Highly motivated, self-starter and quick learner with demonstrated ability to deliver quality results within time constraints. Must be able to handle multiple projects simultaneously under tight timelines.Ability to work in a high-volume, fast-paced, and customer-facing environment.Roll-up your sleeves, can-do attitude to tackle projects large and small with a low-ego, service-oriented approach to collaborating across the organization.Existing understanding of, or ability to quickly learn, laws impacting medical device manufacturers, public policy and healthcare industry developments, as well as the legal implications of business decisions.Areas of desired experience include commercial contracts, software licensing, privacy (HIPAA and related laws), general healthcare law (including Anti-Kickback Statute and Stark), telehealth, government regulations, licensing, and/or compliance.Existing understanding of, or ability to quickly learn the company’s business and products.Demonstrated ability to address commercial, international and business transactional matters, within the life sciences, medical device or related industries.Commitment to developing professional relationships with clients in which corporate goals and priorities are maintained and practical solutions are offered without compromising legal integrity.Demonstrated ability to work both independently and cooperatively with colleagues to leverage skills and knowledge within the legal division. Confident yet coachable and receptive to constructive feedback. Understands when to escalate issues to management for awareness or decision.Exceptional verbal and written communication and presentation skills which highlight an ability to concisely and effectively reach a diverse audience at multiple levels within the Company and through various platforms (i.e., teleconferences, face-to-face meetings, presentations, reports and correspondence).Appropriate competency in Microsoft Office suite, e-signature software, Adobe Acrobat, and other standard workplace hardware and software applications.
Education/Experience Requirements
• Juris Doctorate (JD) or LLM from an American Bar Association accredited law school
A minimum of 3 years of experience providing legal advice on a broad range of business issues, including 2 years at a law firm. A minimum of 4 years strongly preferredPrior in-house experience preferred.Experience in medical device regulations and compliance issues strongly preferred
Travel Requirements
Approximately 10-20%
Additional Information
EOE/M/W/Vet/Disability

At Zimmer Biomet, we believe in The Power of Us, which means that we are stronger together. We are committed to creating an environment where every team member feels included, respected, empowered, and celebrated.

summary:

job_description:
Global Affairs
Legal Affairs
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the opportunity to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 230 million users.
Location
New York
Job type
Permanent
We are looking for an employment counsel to join the band. As employment counsel at Spotify, you will assist in day-to-day employment and labor matters, projects, acquisitions as well as overseeing employment-related disputes.
What you´ll do
Partner with and provide legal guidance to colleagues in Human Resources and other key business partners regarding all substantive employment law areas.
Assist with providing employment legal advice in a broad range of employment related matters and projects, both in the US and globally.
Draft and counsel on employment-related documents, including contracts, offer letters, agreements and policies.
Provide advice and develop strategy with senior leadership on company-wide initiatives affecting employees.
Lead employment law-related projects, including process reviews, new policy creation and implementation, and creation and delivery of training programs.
Handle and/or provide support on employment-related pre-litigation and litigation matters.
Monitor legislation, regulations, case law, and government oversight activities relating to employment issues and provide proactive, strategic advice to the relevant partners.
Counsel key partners concerning employment-related matters in new markets.
Provide legal support for Spotify’s diversity, equity and inclusion efforts.
Who you are
You have a law degree (or equivalent) from a respectable law school.
You have 5+ years of experience working at a credible law firm and/or in-house with employment counseling.
You are experienced in partnering with global partners.
You have guided mergers and acquisitions and post-acquisition work.
You love to unpack legal problems; you can explain legal concepts to non-lawyers.
You are a problem solver, and can stay calm when problems come your way.
You are self-motivated, analytic and can identify and handle the matters at hand without being instructed.
You can balance lots of simultaneous tasks and triage to make sure the right matters get your attention.
You’re willing to dig in on projects.
You work well as part of a team — both with other lawyers and with non-legal partners.
You are qualified to practice law as in-house counsel.
California and international (non-US) experience is desired.
You like to seek new challenges!
Union experience is a plus!
Where you will be
You will work out of the New York Office.
Our offices are currently closed due to COVID-19.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern time zone for collaboration.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.
This role is not eligible for hire in Colorado, USA.
